item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 28, 2024 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. A Beginner's Guide to Switches (22 points | 6 comments)
2. Malware can turn off webcam LED and record video, demonstrated on ThinkPad X230 (499 points | 300 comments)
3. A Washing Machine for Human Beings, from 1970 (45 points | 27 comments)
4. PRoot: User-space implementation of chroot, mount –bind, and binfmt_misc (15 points | 3 comments)

6. You can use C-Reduce for any language (308 points | 67 comments)
7. The Forgotten Story of How IBM Invented the Automated Fab (82 points | 10 comments)
8. Show HN: TeaTime – distributed book library powered by SQLite, IPFS and GitHub (134 points | 25 comments)

24. Device-detector: Universal Device Detection library from User Agent (59 points | 10 comments)
25. Python type hints may not be not for me in practice (90 points | 155 comments)
26. Ultra-low-latency, batching and concurrent queue for IPC in Java (55 points | 20 comments)
27. Show HN: App that asks ‘why?’ every time you unlock your phone (666 points | 331 comments)
28. Psychoacoustic and archeoacoustic nature of ancient Aztec skull whistles (55 points | 25 comments)
29. Pocket 4: Modular full-featured Handheld AI PC (20 points | 13 comments)
